page.title: 05Queensway & Feeder Roads
page.content: The roads in East Kilbride are spec- ially planned to keep through traffic away from shopping centres. From the main roads access to the residential neighbourhoods is usually by means of secondary roads feeding off from the many roundabouts in the town, a feat- ure which gives the town its Citizen Band name of Polo Mint City. The main road running through our area is the A726 (Queensway) which takes traffic to the south-west of Glasgow and Paisley. From this road we have access to various areas of East Kilbride from the various roundabouts; to the Peel Park planned development (see page 4), to the College Milton factories, to the hospital at Hairmyres or further to Kilmarnock via the B764, to Murray, Westwood or West Mains neighbourhoods, to the Town Centre, or to the National Engineering Laboratories.
